contexts.context: ...of it, but between worlds they linger, held to the <mark>hearth</mark> and tomb by blood and loyalty. And if they come...
...never sleep, the summoning to service of those bound through <mark>Hearth</mark> and House to the protection of the clan.
...? Cruel enough is the ancestor's service given in love to <mark>Hearth</mark> and Kin. But ghost or guardian, bonewalker or bonelord...
Only a righteous Dunmer, bound by blood to <mark>hearth</mark> and kin, bound by oath and service to the Temple...
...with profitless treasures, but shall share freely among house and <mark>hearth</mark>.
The blood of broken <mark>hearths</mark> and houses
